text: The Dr. Cobb Pilcher House is a historic house in Forest Hills, Tennessee, U.S.. It was built in 1936 for Dr. Cobb Pilcher, a neurologist at Vanderbilt University. It was designed in the International Style by Warfield and Keeble. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since October 27, 2003. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:International style architecture in Tennessee Category:Houses completed in 1936 Category:Buildings and structures in Davidson County, Tennessee
title: Dr. Cobb Pilcher House
